article_title: Amy Van Dyken-Rouen back in pool for rehab – The Denver Post
article_text:
ENGLEWOOD — Olympic swimmer Amy Van Dyken-Rouen is getting back in the pool as part of her rehabilitation.

A photo of her swimming for the first time since severing her spinal cord in an ATV crash earlier this month was posted to her Instagram account on Tuesday.

The six-time gold medalist tweeted early Tuesday that she was excited to find out she would be swimming later in the day. She found out when a nurse came in the middle of the night to change her position and immediately posted about it using the hashtag #Freedom.

On Monday, she posted a photo of herself standing up with the help of a standing frame at Craig Hospital in suburban Denver, where she arrived last week.

A June 6 ATV crash in Arizona has left the 41-year-old paralyzed just below the waist. The odds of her ever walking again are long but she has impressed her doctors and fans with her positive attitude.

og.description: Amy Van Dyken-Rouen back in pool for rehab

article_summary:
ENGLEWOOD — Olympic swimmer Amy Van Dyken-Rouen is getting back in the pool as part of her rehabilitation.
A June 6 ATV crash in Arizona has left the 41-year-old paralyzed just below the waist.
A photo of her swimming for the first time since severing her spinal cord in an ATV crash earlier this month was posted to her Instagram account on Tuesday.
The odds of her ever walking again are long but she has impressed her doctors and fans with her positive attitude.
On Monday, she posted a photo of herself standing up with the help of a standing frame at Craig Hospital in suburban Denver, where she arrived last week.
